Title: Diary Entry
Text:
Ma Cui: Mr. Painter, can you tell me about this painting?
Painter: It is a farewell gift for you, Mr. Ma, for when you pass away.
Ma Cui: Ha ha ha! You always have such unique ideas.
Painter: I thought it might make you angry.
Ma Cui: My temper has improved since my daughter came into my life.
Painter: She seems quite gentle and kind.
Ma Cui: That's not true. She's always been courageous.
Painter: She doesn't like her given name, Ma Xiaofang.
Ma Cui: And what does that mean to you?
Painter: That she may struggle with facing herself.
Ma Cui: It's not easy to confront our own weaknesses. But I know my child. She will become the bravest of heroes.
Painter: What if she had the chance to save you but failed because of her fears?
Ma Cui: ...
Ma Cui: Mr. Painter, are you being serious?
Painter: Absolutely.
Ma Cui: In that case, I would be honored to witness your exceptional fortune telling skills. But I believe you are mistaken about my daughter.
Painter: About her fate?
Ma Cui: No, about her character.
Ma Cui: If such a moment were to arise, then my passing will mark the beginning of her heroic journey.
Painter: Why do you say that?
Ma Cui: Because I know my child, and one day she will prove to be the bravest of heroes.
Painter: Mr. Ma, you are certainly an interesting man... Let us wait and see what unfolds.
